intro: Pochota cowanii, commonly known as the Mexican chocolate tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Mexico and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in its native range.
